name: VRM: Serenity Center
address: 831 E Houston Ave, Visalia, CA 93292, United States
reviews: Staff tries to be understanding but there is alot of drama. Which is one of the reasons I chose to leave. They are very clean and you must follow the rules which is understandable. Delicious meals and a comfy bed. I was not able to get assistance with visitation. I was informed to reach out to another agency. A few of the women were kind and friendly. You have to take a drug test when asked.  I am not sure how benzos came up on my test. I am involved in a legal matter. Being under the influence is not going to help me when I am fighting to get my daughter back. Hopefully everyone gets the help that they need.

I enjoyed my experience here they did help with comfy bed good meals and showers but one of the ladies here we're Soo rude and mean pls just watch out for this mean lady named Toni/Antonia she is Rude and staff lets her get away with bullying others she stays down your neck about the rules more than staff does just beware of her otherwise it's not so bad

Hey, I found you ladies! Get a FB page! I'm so thankful you let me stay 1 night with you all! Met some very kind people! I want to come back after my court is over. Then I'd like to look for an apartment to share. God bless you, & watch over each of you for all you do

dose anyone know of a woman named Sandra Hernandez she is a homeless lady? she has long black hair and she's has a missing eye..if you see her tell her she has a Daughter that's been trying to find her. I was  adoted at the age of 3 years old..please write back for anymore imformation
Trade work for stay. Find your own church on Sunday. No breakfast/ lunch only dinner. Sober check in daily, check out with staff officers daily.

name: Open Gate Ministries
address: 511 N K St, Dinuba, CA 93618, United States
reviews: I was so grateful to stay here! I got out of an abusive marriage and didn't have anywhere to go. It was during COVID when everything was crazy. You had to do what they asked (keep everything clean, get a job, get all the things you need to get welfare and housing) which was a breeze after what we went though. I only stayed a month, but the first night we were there they found out it was my daughter's birthday the day before and they threw a birthday party at the last minute. My daughter was so happy. They also added a snack in between breakfast and lunch because my kids and the other family that moved in would get hungry in between breakfast and lunch while we were there. They let us visit when my dad came from out of state as well. I also loved the room set up and the bedding. They had a TV and toys and books in the living room.  I stayed friends with some of the people I met there before moving to Coachella Valley and getting my own place in Palm Springs.

If you are lazy or don't want to improve your situation, just don't come. This place is the only shelter in the county that let my family stay together. We have our own, private room. There's an individualized case plan for each intake and they truly care to help you leave here better than you came in. I love it here.

This place is horrible that lady Cheryl treated me and my family horribly my son got food poisoning and couldn't eat for several days and she told me I couldn't make him anything different because it wasn't fair to the other families so my son went hungry for 2 days cause we weren't aloud to give him anything different. Also the local Walmart donates soaps and good for the families and Cheryl would pick and chose of what she wanted and would leave the things she didn't want for the families. I was told that I was living a lavish lifestyle I couldn't afford and was told I shouldn't have the car I had if I was homeless but let's not forget people don't chose to be homeless it just happens sometimes I was told if I didn't have to be there then why was I SMH it was a horrible stay but let me tell you ALEX she was amazing she's the sweetest most loving person in that entire shelter she helped me get thru alot of those hard days and stressful nights at that horrible place she made it easy to be there when she was working. This so called religion based place isn't so holy when you see the movement behind those closed doors they discriminate and make you feel like a low life good for nothing person... and it's like you can never catch a break in that place I would NEVER recommend this stay to anyone it was a nightmare. The only good thing that I got out of this place was the friendships I found with some of the families I met but other than that it's  true what one of the other comments said they will lie,decive and  do what they can to keep other people in and kick others out it's crazy if I ever were to hit hard times like that again I would definitely be better off staying in my car for sure but thank the good lord those extremely stressful nights and long days are past us now. If I could just put a zero star I would.

Discriminating and deceiving they will talk behind your back, staff will start drama and you will get reprimanded and no apologies will ever be given. They lie to other ppl staying and tell you to lie about situations so some ppl can stay longer than others, they also use food stamps without permission some times and lie about amount

A place to call home while waiting for your new one. They help you stay warm, find rest & learn structure. A good place that teaches you to value routine, discipline & learn to realign your priorities for a better future. The rooms are welcoming and feel more like mini apartments 🥰 God is good, the people are kind & you can definitely see the love of Christ here at work ❤️

name: Salvation Army
address: 1200 N B St, Sacramento, CA 95811, United States
reviews: we can be grateful but we can also be wise and tell the truth about mistreatment, neglect, possible elder abuse. too many people here with pee and booboo problems can't care for themselves. left to the other tenants to clean behind them because staff either refuses to gather up pee and booboo bedding or leaves it for the next shift. men come on women's patio and when told to leave, they cuss the women out. even in real time telling staff a man is on women's patio screaming,  staff will not budge but instead ask dumb questions instead of seeing for themselves. All 3 of them, nothing. thermostats set to however cold outside, inside temp gets colder instead of setting it the opposite to get warmer. main hall is 60 degrees! dayroom 66-69 degrees. Dorm 67, 68, 69 degrees until about 2:30pm it goes to 72-75. At night it creeps back into the 60s at about midnight. It's cold with alot of elderly here. At 6am dorm is 66-68 degrees.  It made it to 71 at 3:15pm the other day. Dayroom stays at 66, 67, all day! Staff makes excuses about who has the key who doesn't have it and how many maintenance men they told to change it. passing the blame. cold for 2 weeks now affecting my health.

My apologies. Food are so delicious.
7am breakfast, 12pm for lunch, 4pm for dinner. Do not bring in brink of the bottles to th Cafe . They do provided of water, tea, coffee with cream also. Please do not bully!

This is a very special place providing opportunities for veterans of all ages As well as homeless individuals !!  My lord Jesus Salvation Army Has been providing for the community for over 130 years I’m still going strong 💪
This place is truly amazing and manager truly goes above and beyond. The cooks do a fantastic job.
A great place which offers resources, a place to stay, meals, ECT. Nice friendly supportive staff. A place that truly cares.

name: Next Move Homeless Services
address: 8001 Folsom Blvd, Sacramento, CA 95826, United States
reviews: I have filed a compliant with irs. To review fund usage. as a homeless single mom I’ve never been allowed to actually use the clothing closet.  I’ve been 4-5 times I have a two year old .I’ve received one pair of paints two bars of soap one tampon and one blanket over a two year period and multiple emails and calls I’m treated dismissively when I come and beg for more information about how to utilize, I’m sent to other nonprofits that also just pass the budget. I’m always told there’s no clothes and to go online to utilize their services , but online is not accurate and the phones and emails aren’t returned….. I’m sorry but they seem to not be doing what they claim. they act uncomfortable when answering simple question about how to utilize their services …. they only cater imo to single male one person homeless families and not in a meaningful way that would help them move on from being homeless in downtown Sacramento, they do not allow children inside, and they seem to turn away women in need. The services they say they have they just don’t… there seem to be no services for single women with children to truly utilize here or in Sacramento other than calworks EBT and wic
11042024 voicemail is full at NEXT MOVE.  DOES NEXT MOVE PROVIDE ON THEIR WEBSITES AN LENGTH OF STAY FOR ALL THEIR PROGRAMS IF THEY WORK WITH THE CITY?

I was here with my special needs son in 2020. We were not given any help and no matter how many list we got on for transitional housing we were always called back saying that we were denied due to my son's disability they told us that because of his condition and he hit other kids they could not give us housing. People who had children with autism or targeted, a lady was made to go outside and sleep in her car because her child was special needs was nocturnal which is common with a lot of children with special needs she was also threatened with CPS even though she had done absolutely nothing to her child. I was also threatened with CPS and that was another reason why I did not feel safe there apart from the neighborhood also being unsafe and all the shootings that were going on while I was there I felt very insane. Staff screened at us verbally abused me and my son. I also witnessed a lady that had twins and when she got to the shelter she had nothing this was during the pandemic so even though there was a places for people would come through domestic violence they couldn't get into those places because of the pandemic and the restrictions that it caused. This lady asked the staff if they could help her get diapers to which they responded that she would have to buy some. They also made us sign up for things like tablets but they were never given to us they were never delivered to us they were never basically given to us by the staff. I also witnessed staff receiving donations of clothing but not actually giving that clothing to the people that were at the homeless shelter I witness them loading it into the back of their cars and taking it with them. And I also witnessed the same exact thing with the towels and the blankets that were given for the homeless people they would take them home with them in the back of their cars put it in their trunk. We were highly discriminated against simply because we were light skinned, even though I am Hispanic I was discriminated against by these people who were African American. I had never experienced something like this and it was absolutely the most horrible experience I've ever had I left the homeless shelter and found a room to live in which I was very grateful for because that's why I had come to the homeless shelter to try to find housing and they were of no help whatsoever in fact they would tell the transitional housing places that my son was too difficult in that they should not take me and my son. I experienced a lot of racism simply because I was Hispanic and I was experiencing that from Caucasian social workers as well as African-American social workers. The experience was absolutely horrible eye opening and I don't wish it on anybody.

I have been unable to reach anyone at this place. I doubt its even real at all! I tried to email and they both got blocked or not sent. I even copied and pasted the email into the correct place so I know I didn't misspell the email.

I visited Next Move last week for the first time to drop off something for a person from my church. The area seems to be ran down with some homeless people living in the parking lot and working on cars there as well. It is in need of Rehabilitation and Renovation badly. When I pulled up I watched by the manager Steve closely he watched my every move, I never left my car and the person came downstairs to pick up somethings from me. After I left the tenant was written up and reprimanded for my 7 minute visit. Next Move should be there to assist their tenants and not harass them. They all come from different situations and circumstances, some out of their control. Perhaps the Directors, Board of Chairman’s and whoever else is in charge should come and talk to their tenants one on one to see what is really happening at Next Move. The mission is great but they are in need of some majors changes from staff to apartments to the entire area. ☹️

name: Eureka Rescue Mission
address: 110 2nd St, Eureka, CA 95501, United States
reviews: Basically a prison with no rules or security. I saw people assault staff and other people there including myself. They actually tossed me out after I got out of the hospital, even though I didn't do anything. Food sucks as well as sleeping on the floor on a mat right next to a hundred other people and they wake us up 6 and then make you sit outside in courtyard rain or shine. Basically hell on earth.
Very positive place to stay where you arent judged and are given stability while trying to get back on your own feet!
They do such a great job feeding people in Eureka. Donations are always welcome.

I am impressed with the caring people who run the Mission.  They are doing all they can to help the homeless and addicted.  A family member has been living there off and on for years.  This place has such a heart to help the homeless.   We need a few more of these in the area.....God bless the people there.
I live at this place in the program.And let me tell you what we are not very far from hell

name: Arcata House Partnership ANNEX ONE STOP
address: 501 9th St, Arcata, CA 95521, United States
reviews: Really good place for people in transition or having a hard time with life they have help food showers
Rimmy is cool. But the office has a problem of calling you back. When they say they will
They have been there for 90%of my peeps and myself . I love all of them  they all rock this city.

Disabled senior cancer survivor. Cannot get a housing voucher for the covid. All calls go unreturned. I am definitely high risk and homeless. Have made repeated attempts to find out about vouchers that were granted specifically for this reason. Very confusing,and disheartening to say the least. I've abandoned all hope of aquiring any assistance at all.
They take forever to call someone in need of help …

name: Betty's Blue Angel Village
address: Eureka, CA 95501, United States
reviews:
Don't live here if ya wanna actually live.   It's like a animal exhibit more than anything.   We were kicked out when we were doing very well, then Betty tried to take it all away.  Kinda funny.

Need help? Aww poor thing, let me tease you with my wealth - betty

Back in school Betty spoke about many things, and she was very uplifting.  But that was flushed down how she treated us.

Like labrats

Then out because I got a car, and Betty didnt like that !!

I understand needing to impose restrictions, but Betty was mentally and physically abusive to me and others - kicking some people out randomly without discussing what they did wrong, while desperately helping her few select favorites. Severe abuse of power and resources. If you find yourself in this area and needing help, please go to the Mission or call for emergency help instead.

Betty is as selfish and crooked as they come.  Her foundation is a joke and she lives high on the hog from the public's contributions while sharing the bare minimum with the people she's sworn to help. Treating them as poorly as some would treat a rat invading their sanctuary.

This place should be called "Betty Chinn Rules Enforcement Foundation" because housing people takes a backseat to zero tolerance rules enforcement.  I didn't even break them, and they threw me out. Plus they refused my reasonable request for accommodation under ADA, and kicked me out for having the issue I was requesting accomodation for. After they threw me out I asked, in writing, if they'd let me use their toilets, and they ignored me. I am nobody to them. When I protested that they were throwing me out over their mistake and not mine, the attendant laughed at me and ridiculed me and started provoking me and got me worked up then started filming me and suggesting I get violent. I left screaming, then screamed and cried uncontrollably outside their gate for hours, and they never even so much as offered me a cup of water.

Three stars because the rec room was nice and the portapotties were clean.

Betty is the greatest. This location is her "container village". It is basically a bunch of shipping containers that have been converted into makeshift living space. Beats sleeping on the streets though, especially when it is raining. Located conveniently next to the Dept of Health and Human Services on Koster Street.

name: Human Response Network
address: 111 Mountain View St, Weaverville, CA 96093, United States
reviews: What can I say about hrn they helped us get in to a place that I am grateful for then a week and a half two weeks later they took it away from us they asked us all these questions if we had any an outstanding bills our fines or anything like that and I said no my husband said no that we had all our ducks pretty much in order we did stuff without them even asking us then all of a sudden there was a wet spot in my child's room we told them about it we found out that the hot water heater was leaking and they kicked us out because of that and a few other things that were out of our control I don't think that's fair at all I have four children and where part of the carr fire we have nowhere to go and we thought this was going to be our home for at least 6 months until we got on are feet and save some money to get a new place we thought things were looking up for us but it turned out it wasn't we haven't even heard from our workers since the 24 .we live in Weaverville California and because of the carr fire the power keeps shutting off and on so we had to reschedule with our real social worker now another social worker keeps coming over and she's not very nice I know this isn't a rant or rave thing but we really need some help or some advice anything would help thank you and have a good night
Wonderful service,thank you for doing my taxes for free. Do a lot for community, families, kiddos,even car seats for toddlers.
Hrn is so helpful and friendly.  They don't make you feel bad about having to need help ever.
They're here to help the community. It made my life a little easier!
It was fun, they offerred a traing to teens in the area to attend a Expect Respect Leadership training, giving the teens two awards, and also provided lunch for the group!

name: Tracy Community Connections Center
address: 95 W 11th St #206, Tracy, CA 95376, United States
reviews: I've written reviews about places before I'll start think about writing positive reviews from now on if there is a new Era with Jesus chirst. Anyway back in December 2023 I was with saint Vincent dipol. Racist Mary not the virgin Mary racist Mary said I was mentally ill without evidence I saw that racist stare of her when she looked at me. Shiree said she fired her. One of the reviews was under the name Brandon which stated saying that shiree was awful too. My experience with shiree I think she is the best person at tcc but she did not give me 10 minutes to stay in her office to finish off something on my laptop because I needed the wifi. Shiree kicked me out explaining she needs to have a nice warm dinner with her family while I suffer and that night I was cold hungry sleeping with a little blanket and no tent and then the next day kimberly from valley mountain regional center saved me she saved me on her day off.

I PRAY THAT  NOBODIES LIFE LANDS THEM AT THIS  DOORSTEP! I had minimal contact that will unfortunately last  me a lifetime! Shame on you!

FYI… do not send an automated apology asking for more information. Ask  Sheree or Shiree ? Not interested .

Told me twice someone would call me back about my emergency but no one ever did even after I called again  to remind them but left a message because no One answered they still never returned my call. I understand that they are busy, there's a lot of people who need their services but I received no response to determine how important my call was. It's too late now so thanks anyway!

They are a bunch of filthy liars! They said they would help me and my family but they didn't!
Every time someone opens a file with them they get paid! They told us they can help with our rent, said they have 1,600 to help us out. Opened our file renewed it and boom! Never hear from them again UNTIL.... THEY WANT TO CALL TO RE-NEW OUR FILE! 😤
By the grace of God we were able to pay our rent (Praise Jesus) never again!
Genesis 12:3
" I will bless those who bless you, and whoever curses you I will curse"

Remember! You reap what you sow!
God is a Just God what's done in the dark will come to light!
Leslie worked with me, I was homeless 2weeks ago. Leslie is Genuine in respect, diligence, and kindness.  The staff was respectful and helpful. Thank you Leslie, you helped me change my life.

name: The Village Of Love
address: 431 Stardust Pl, Alameda, CA 94501, United States
reviews: The Village of Love is exactly that.  They help everyone they can.  This is a service that is unique and beneficial to those they help and the community at large.  It makes Alameda a better place because it shows the compassion the city has to help those in distress or needing help to get back up on their feet.

And I choose to not make any statements here except for I'll say this the sick and elderly people should have first priority over anyone who's waiting for an apartment or assistance because  I would rather have my health and a job more than being on government assistance I don't like being in a walker. I worked hard all my life and now I'm not I miss working I would gladly switch places with anyone else right now just to have my health and working again I don't care how much assistance I get I would give it all up to have my health again it's so not fair I feel very cheated out of my life 😭😭😭😭😭😭 I'm sorry for sounding down and negative and I'm not pointing fingers at anyone cause I don't know everyone please let me go back to work I will give anything or trade places with someone who wants to be on government assistance and I would give up an apartment to anyone who wants it just so I could go back to work. I mean that with all my heart.

The people.
At this shelter don't seem to care about the homeless people that they're helping as a homeless person. I would say not to go there. As a prior homeless person, I would say in my opinion. Go anywhere else from my experience. They try to regulate rules throughout the entire city on home as people make it impossible for you to make money to survive and tell you that you cannot leave their parking place with your car unattended at any point in time. This is not a safe parking place. This is an internment camp.

Village of love is not a lodging option.  They are a resource center that provide help. For low income, homeless and registered vehicle owners park and stay overnight. That are  member's with The Village of love. Gotta Love The VillOfLove :)
Sharing our old clothes and giving them a second life. Nothing better.

name: St. Mary's Community Services
address: 545 W Sonora St, Stockton, CA 95203, United States
reviews:
St Mary’s place is hell. I recommend not to go to this place for your kids. I have arrived here around November 15th 2024. This place here does not help out at all their rules are like top notch it’s ridiculous. The staff are very disrespectful and take points for no reason. There is a staff members lie, abuse, disrespectful attitudes, and many more about them. The case managers do not help at all either. Case managers are disrespectful and do not care about kids mental health and many more. The St Mary’s cafeteria is disgusting they have expired food and drinks.
I have seen apple juice from year 2024 December 1st and also they put some type of medicine in the water. St Mary’s does not let you get stuff done. They have all these meetings around like in the morning and afternoon. This place adds more and more rules everyday. The showers are disgusting and the bathrooms are not cleaned. The people who live here have to clean it. Kids cannot even stay home if they’re sick. This place is not what you think it is. The case managers do not want you to tell the cops or anyone how they treat people here. They abuse children and adults. They treat us like robots or slaves. They is way more where that came from to. Kids can’t cry when they’re hurt or overwhelmed. Staff and admin do room checks and tell us to downsize. They told me to get rid of my clothes and hygiene items and also toys. Kids cannot play here at all. When you do delivery’s you have to go up to the front gate and do not send them in the back even if you are pregnant or sick. Also people gossip stay to yourself because clients here like to argue. DO NOT EVER GO HERE.

If in need  of housing, food , clothing see if you qualify .  I Had a professional experience work related and it is amazingly shocking the services they provide for individuals who are in need.  Housing, food, medical are some of the services offered.

Interesting reviews..it sounds like St. Mary is loved by the people who take advantage of their services..1 person has used the services for 20 yrs...Wow.. Handouts shouldn't be a lifetime thing..I must visit..
Great place to live, when your homeless;? Thank you for all the help you, provide!thank you kindly for your kindness and support;most of GOD;! Blessings for all that supports, this ministries! !

Saint Mary's is such a wonderful place. They offer every service you could possibly want or need when you need it. They have housing help, shelter, hot meals,clothing, dentist,medical,court help,tax help,and the employees and volunteers are amazing people

name: Abode Services Sunrise Village Emergency Shelter
address: 588 Brown Rd, Fremont, CA 94539, United States
reviews: 330  am -5 am people driving in parking with stereo loud and people singing loud. People banging on windows for clients to let them in because nobody at front desk.
Refused to return my calls, did I take twice in over a month span...deleted from the system and NEVER GOT A RETURN CALL DESPITE LEAVING MANY MESSAGES

This place will definitely make your stay a nightmare if things don't go their way. Check your food there's mold. The staff will definitely hold grudges. The fact that it is better than being outside they will definitely make sure you stay in a homeless state of mind. They dare you to feel free and safe or speak your mind. Perfect place for imates. If you have an inmates mentality this is the perfect place for you. I was kicked out because the staff refused to retrieve my food box and when I confronted her for her foulness I was kicked out into the rain and they kept all my food and refuse to place me in the que for housing after I spent a year there cleaning disgusting gnats that flew in my hair and mouth as I slept. The coordinators refuse to listen to us as a human because we’re homeless (I’m guessing) but I watched a woman strike another woman in the face for no reason but I get kicked out for knowing my rights.

These people do not help the families who stay there & the staff likes to terrorize residents by turning on the heaters during 80°+ weather even though they refuse to turn it on in the winter. We stayed there for 4 months & they did not help us find any housing, then they stole our stuff on the way out. They have our $100 Vornado fan, a bunch of our kids clothes & containers, & my husband's family blanket. 1 staff member, Deb, uses drugs & hits on the male residents. She would not leave my husband alone, constantly coming to our door to bother us & ask him to do things & asking him to hug her.

Vicious People. No support services whatsoever. Staff is just completely corrupt because there is no oversight for a homeless shelter. You'd think it was a punishment to be there, not a rescue type situation. The residents and staff collude to terrorize you. It's like jail is depicted in T.V. Only the toughest survive there.

name: Modoc County Department of Social Services
address: 120 N Main St, Alturas, CA 96101, United States
reviews: They don't have funding for emergency housing... Water shut off after office worker stole my payment water company.. shut off Nov 12 notice for payment was Dec 9th.. She stated they can do whatever they want... Includes stealing my truck which is at Murray's house I've been told...

Amazing is an understatement. The Department of Social Services in Modoc County does the most amazing things for its community. It's astonishing the lengths they'll go to in order to help you, and your family. There's NO judgement when you walk through their doors. They make you feel completely comfortable and confident with whatever situation you may be in. Everybody in this office is so welcoming, and helpful you can't go wrong with whatever program you need help with. From the bottom of our hearts my family appreciates, and is so thankful for everything the Department of Social Services in Modoc County has done for us. Thank you ALL.

My son has received disability services for over 30 years.  He's had all the assessments to verify his condition over the years.  Then, Alturas Social Services said that he had to apply for MediCal, but he has it, and has had it for 30+ years.  They insisted.  So we did what they said, and now both his Medicare and MediCal have been cut off.  He tried o make a doctor appointment and was told that he has no insurance.  Instead of the 3rd he will now receive a much smaller check "about the third week" of each month.  We tried to talk to Social Services and they said to call Social Security. Social Security said to go to their on line site, which is no help at all.  Now what?  Called mental health, but can only leave a message that is not answered.
Very friendly and helpful
Amazingly awesome ppk

name: High Plateau Humane Society
address: 114 E 1st St, Alturas, CA 96101, United States
reviews: Kim is a very on topic caring lady for the kittens. Price is a reasonable for items they have for sale in the retail store. We tried to go there every couple weeks for good bargains

Jenn has been wonderful to work with during our dog adoption process. Her professionalism and dedication to her work helped us feel confident that we were adopting the right dogs for us. While visiting her home, we were struck by how happy all of the dogs were, and healthy too. We would recommend HPHS to anyone seriously looking for their perfect pet!

The people who run High Plateau Humane Society are professional and caring.  They have done extensive work on the facility, improved  the cat enclosure, and do their best to find homes for dogs and cats.  I greatly appreciate their presence and their contributions to the animal world and to our tiny community.  We are fortunate to have such an active humane society in our isolated area.

Very helpful and responsive. I was just passing through town and reported a stray cat hanging around my hotel. A volunteer responded to my message right away, and the cat was in their care a day later. A happy ending for the sweet cat, and one less breeding male roaming and mating! Great rescue, much appreciated.

Please look for another adoption agency if you are looking for dogs. I believe that the woman that runs the dog adoptions is fraudulently taking money from people. Her name is Jennifer Anderson. Everything that she told us was incorrect. The adoption fee of $350 included the chip (that she gave to us in a baggy), first puppy shots and $100 to be refunded when we showed proof of neuter. She spoke at length  about how important it was to neuter at roughly 6 months, because of hormones and growth. Also, Ms. Anderson was very aggressive in her request that we make out own dog food. To the point that I thought she wouldnt let us adopt if we didnt agree with the request. When we took our new puppy to our vet, we found out that he already had a chip, and they strongly requested that we NOT make our own food unless we're consulting with a dog nutritionist. 6 months go by and we're patiently waiting for our puppy's balls to drop and surprisingly they never did. After contact with Ms. Anderson 7 months later, she said that she had forgotten and our puppy had already been neutered. That's kind of a big forget. She also told me not to listen to my vet about dog nutrition. She had done the "research" and she knew better. It should be noted that Ms. Anderson is not a veterinarian, but she is a moron. I encourage Alturas to find another person to run their dog adoptions.

name: Teach Inc
address: 112 E 2nd St, Alturas, CA 96101, United States
reviews: Always helpful. Thank you too the employees and volunteers

I submitted an application for a wood voucher in December and have heard nothing since, though I stopped by two days before Christmas, placed a call and sent an email today. It's understood that time is required for this, but a return call seems appropriate in this case considering that we have had several inches of snow fall. My experience with TEACH prior to this has been fairly good, the thrift store is excellent and everything moves smoothly in the food line, but trying to actually apply for something seems to be very difficult for some and no problem at all for others. This is disappointing, and I hope to hear from someone soon, given that I heat my home with a woodstove and have been getting along by the kindness of a friend's friends. At this rate I will be unable to comfortably suggest TEACH as a place to obtain help when it's truly needed.

They don't always write the truth during visits. My tiny four year old was abused in both foster homes 😡. I reported what she said and my other children told them how they were screamed at, and the foster mom acted totally different around people. 😡 My son declined seconds at breakfast and was forced to go without food until the next day. I even reported it to the ombudsman. There was also another report of abuse for the same foster home at the same time. Everything was swept under the rug nothing was done My children are still being abused right now.

Teach is Modoc County's best source
Of help there is, they just recently
Took over our Senior Center dinning
Room. They are the port in the storm.
I have gotten fire wood from them 4
Years in a role.
They are so kind and heart felt.Thank
Too you ALL

Really helped me out when I needed it with no hassle.  Stern faces when I first showed up, but that is par for the course when asking for help because of the types of people they "probably" deal with just because of the industry (community/social work) in general.

Only complaint is the three cans of spam they gave me in my bag of free food.  Spam e-mail and cans of Spam.  Not good!  If you work there and are reading this... Smile!  :)  I'm only mentioning the Spam to make you smile.  Thank you!

name: Hearts With A Mission Youth Shelter
address: 521 Edwards St, Medford, OR 97501, United States
reviews: Hearts was a great place for my daughter in her time of need! She wasn't sure at 1st because she felt that her Dad and I were abandoning her. She made lots of bonds with the staff and other kids.  She was always respectful and listened to their rules. She did what was asked of her. She also definitely learned so much and grown from her experience at Hearts! Staff is truly amazing! I absolutely love Hearts with a mission and I'm truly forever grateful!

Hearts with a Mission is amazing home for homeless, at-risk young adults. The staff is amazing and offers encouragement, structure and assistance in helping these young people find their adult legs. They help them become compassionate, gain self-respect and integrity so they will be wonderful citizens in our communities. I am thankful for their ever out reaching, caring, training, loving arms to our communities and to these young adults. Thank you Hearts for having a huge heart for our next generation of teachers, managers, and entrepreneurs!

Kids who want to change their lives can at Hearts With a Mission.  If a kid is not willing to work and follow some simple rules and the structure that has been tried and true for over a decade and with over 1000 youth, it may not be the right place for them.  I assure you that staff at Hearts With a Mission make every effort to love and and care for each kid both during and after they stay there.  Bonds are made for a lifetime!!  Also, I’ve worked in and around residential programs for 20 years as a staff, administrator and a licensor.  You will not find homes any nicer, well decorated/furnished, cleaner or well taken care of then the ones that Hearts With a Mission offers to runaway and homless youth in our community.  Our community has generously saw to that detail!  Ya, are kids hard on the facility?  You bet!!  They're kids and kids are often taught how to make repairs when they do cause damage.  It’s part of growing up and taking responsibility for one’s actions and Hearts sees those moments as opportunities for growth.

Hearts With a Mission is a place where a kid can go and feel safe. The staff really become family and they love on everyone and anyone who walks through those doors! If you are a kiddo in need of a safe space come to Hearts!

I came in as a 16 year old with no where to go. I didnt have a safe stable home and was couch hopping. Hearts took me In with open arms and I became part of their family. They don't care who you are or what your past is they just want to provide the youth and teens with safe housing, food to eat, showers, and even help with providing a plan to get out of the situation that made you homeless. They want to see you grow and learn to become a responsible adult and will provide what you need to complete that goal. They support you and are there for you through everything and make it known you always have a safe place to go. Hearts and safe families helped bring my family back together and not only helped me but also my mom with her addiction habits and reached out to her as well. If you need a safe place to go and focus on yourself and your needs, and not worry about simply surviving or housing, I strongly recommend HWAM.

name: 40 Prado Homeless Services Center
address: 40 Prado Rd, San Luis Obispo, CA 93401, United States
reviews: Brand new building serving 100 people with 50 person overflow. Community partners such as Mental Health, Drug and Alcohol and Community Health Center use some of the offices. Hot meals provided, computers, laundry and showers available. Day center and detox coming soon.

Dr. Willis Is the Best Doctor Bar None, I’ve Ever Been To!  He's Totally Committed to All of his patients!!  In Short, He’s The  Best Doctor I’ve ever been to!!!
Also, I go there to donate Clothing, Shoes to less unfortunate people. I've been there I know what it's like not to have anything and not to know where you're going to live or how it's even possible to get there? They're doing a great job at Prado I think. Everybody's got so much stuff nowadays, certainly wouldn't hurt anyone to start donating some things to this place for less unfortunate people that have nothing! I thank God that Prado was there when I needed them!

Needs to bring back no tolerance and stop with no proper training for staff to deal with the population of addiction and mental health. Clean it up bring chores back to everyday to create healthy habits for future independence. Structure consistency is needed in the world with empathy and compassion.
I was very nice to eat and  meet new people @ the homeless shelter .

Dr. Willis is the best primary care doctor I've ever had.  He is very thoughtful with decision making and he cares.  It would be 5 stars if the wait-time wasn't so long.  I may be going to the Templeton office as well.  :)

reviews: There have several hair and body lice outbreaks. I’ll modify my current rating when these are resolved. Aside from breakfast being pretty much the same every day The meals for lunch and dinner typically aren’t bad at all. They even have pizza every now and then.
Very clean and nice staff and great food clothes and showers

Today I have an intake scheduled for 12 noon... I've never been here before.... upon arrival, I'm sure the expression I had on my face said more than a million words could that were running through my head.... but I need help!!!...  and today I hope to get that started!!...  I have high hopes for this place, and all the faces this place may grace!
Lizzy is unprofessional. Down road of Authoritative misconduct no manners.
Terrible customer service skills they were rude

name: Community Action Partnership of San Luis Obispo County (CAPSLO)
address: 1030 Southwood Dr, San Luis Obispo, CA 93401, United States
reviews: I’m so blessed this program helps me to live thank you to all the staff for all your help and kindness

My step dad is an 84 yr. Living in a Mobil home park.  He now receives 24 hour care.  He no longer is physically able to work on repairs or pay for the help and appliances needed.  There are no other means to pay.for assistance.

CAP has come to our rescue, we have been with them a few years and had help with roof that had been leaking.  We had gone two winters without a heater until CAP replaced.  We got a new refrigerator, new shower heads, fire alarm, lighting, a new back door and new kitchen and bathroom floor repair due to water damage.  Just last week, our main bathroom floor was more severely damaged than when we first got the report.  Our bathroom floor looks brand new, what a fantastic job the CAP team did!

We just wouldn’t have been able to afford all those repairs and appliance purchases.

We were blessed beyond anything imagined and wish we could compensate the organization.  They work with funding issues and they worked hard for our case.  Saying thank you just doesn’t seem enough of what we have in our ♥️ hearts.  Dell had stood out, we got to see him the most. He was a joy to have him return.   We were educated and never made to feel  guilt or shame for needing their services.  And knowing that others may have not gotten their needs met due to funding and all the work they helped us with.  The team every time were so kind and professional.

God love you all and if I was a fairy with a magic wand, all your needs would be met and to each of you who participated in our projects, you’d be heading to Vegas and the first machine you select would be sprinkled with fairy dust!  And that machine would be flowing with $$$ to help you make some dreams come true……

Hello just a note to thank Tom Potter and the rest of the staff at CAPSLO in San Luis Obispo for making it possible to transition from living homeless to having a new home. Everyone is so helpful and Tom really showed his commitment to getting us housed quickly by being available literally everyday on the phone and meeting with us at several properties until we found the right match. Thank you again Tom and Floyd, Tanda, and the rest of the crew at CAPSLO for a five star job well done.

There are some groups in this world that genuinely work hard for no other reason than to help people in need. This is one of the best examples of that. CAPSLO helps people in our community of all ages from all walks of life. I've had the pleasure of working with them only once but I fully intend on offering my time and donations again and again.

I am only commenting on the quality of the work done on my house. Leaky bathtub faucet changed to new but the spigot is still not stable and the on/off nozzle was not installed properly...keeps coming off. Outside and on closer inspection, the work done on my back porch to replace some steps is uneven, shoddy work. Safe? Yes. Done well? No. I'll hire a plumber to redo the work done in my bathroom. Eventually, the back steps will be redone as well. Sorry   to leave this review.

name: Plumas Rural Services Inc.
address: 711 E Main St, Quincy, CA 95971, United States
reviews: These wonderful people helped me turn around from wronged and homeless into a housed successful adult I couldn't do it with out these precious organizations such as this one helping find my feet again, as I've said wonderful people, friendly, always smiling, and always there to reach a hand of help when you are the furthest down on your knees that you've ever been these people will be there for you I promise! 🙏❤️❤️❤️ God bless you all 🙏

Great at first… then pretty much told me i wasnt abused badly enough to get their services anymore and their shelter was too full for me and my daughter to stay there. Come to find out from someone who is there, the house is not full. Is it better to go back to the abuser or just be on the streets with ny child?

Can't say enough about how the services here have helped me so much.  Have to give an extra shout out to a lady that is such an angel.  I was blessed to have her helping me threw the last year. My disaster case manager. Mrs Nancy.
Went to the historic Chinese cemetery behind this place. Pretty cool. Had lunch with a friend. Love cemeteries.
I go to this building for my WIC appointments and both the WIC and transit staff are friendly, helpful, and welcoming.

Always helpful and full of knowledge! We love all the assistance they provide to our small town!
Have been awesome helping myself…..

name: Lassen Family Services, Inc
address: 1306 Riverside Dr, Susanville, CA 96130, United States
reviews: The ladies at lassen family services have all always been very kind and helpful to me in times of needing assistance and always try to help in any way they can even providing other resources available in the community many don't know of ...thank you for all your support and help 💜🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

LFS has been so helpful I am overwhelmed. No one or Entity has done so much to help me.  The Staff is exceptional and filled with positive nurture, and skilled in Mental Health and Domestic Abuse issues.  Very good People who work there who are not prejudiced against race or gender.

The foundation of this facilities core is undeniably selfless, as it aids in helping those who are facing hardship, abuse and temporary set backs. They genuinely care and take your pain and trials and mold it into a positive and life changing situation. The kindhearted and graceful ladies working here make it easy to find hope again after the hurt and downfall. Thank you LFS for being the loving and supportive organization that makes this city great!

What's not to love? LFS has many helpful services. From diapers and clothing to supportive peer groups. Stephanie went way above and beyond to file and refile a restraining order to protect my family, and move out orders to get rid of an unwanted meanie. 🤗 Don't wait until Lassen County steals your kids to find their programs free and helpful.🤣😂🤣😁🤣😂

This place was an outstanding place help me out tremendously. I love the suppurt team great impact  on my bvb familys life Lori, Angie, and  staff Were very supportive. Love u all we need more people like u all that are making a difference like u did in my life....

name: Crossroads Ministries
address: 2410 Main St, Susanville, CA 96130, United States
reviews:
I enjoyed the daily services provided, as well as, the shelter portion. The staff members are professional to say the least and friendly.
I would highly recommend this program/shelter to anyone in need of recovery tools/breakfast, lunch or dinner/a place to sleep.

Stay the night for free up to 30 days: you get a mat and a sheet, sometimes a pillow and blanket.  Schedule, rules, the staff and programs below.

Dinner is about 7pm some nights then a free 10 minute shower. (More rules below).

Monday through Friday schedule:
Morning
Doors open for free breakfast at 7am (eat at 7:30) then Bible study at 8am,
You can sometimes do laundry free at 9am.

Free lunch at noon

They kick everyone out at about 12:30pm.

Evenings: doors open:
Monday night @ 8pm (after Bible study)
Tuesday night @ about 8:30pm (after Bible study)
Wednesday night at about 6:25pm (movie night: Jesus and Bible Movies with ice cream and popcorn)
Thursday at about 6:30pm
Friday night at about 8:20pm (after celebrate recovery event)

Weekend schedule:
They kick everyone out at about 6:30am and lock the doors until the evening.
Most Saturday nights have dinner and worship starting at maybe 5:30pm? Last I heard it was 6pm but when I got there, everyone had already eaten dinner and there was none left.  So I think it's dinner at 5:30pm and worship / Bible at 6pm then ice cream after 7pm (after the sermon ends).
Sunday: out by 6:30am and wander Susanville until about 6:30pm; dinner most Sundays at about 7pm.

Coffee Monday through Friday all day (except when they kick you out and lock the door)

Staff:
Daniel brings it all day. He likes to work.
Jake brings it all day
Josiah
Susan's prayer game is strong.
Robin is on the board and leads some Bible studies
Joe does cool things for the people.
Jacob will listen at Judy's House

Free water out back if you pass through. Red spigot, lift the handle for water.

More classes:
Communications classes or battlefields of the minds classes some days at 9:30am

Programs:
The main program is (I will try to write more later)
Their drug recovery program is 12 months long.
Three strikes and you're out

Rules:
They only allow people to enter in the back door.
No parking out back unless they allow you.
Sign in first before doing anything.
You can't use the fridge.
You can't touch the fridge.
Walk between the red lines.
You can sometimes use the phone
Meet with staff once per week
Don't touch food when they're serving it.
No hanging out in the back unless the doors open in the next 30 minutes.
No alcohol or drugs
Don't leave the property after 8pm
Don't go outside after 10pm or they'll lock you out

Great people! Kind hearts! If you are in need they will try there best to help you and say prayer with you. They offer meal every once in awhile and a food bag if hungry, they have even given me diapers before because I literally didn't know what to do and had no way to diaper my child for a week and gave my 2 older kids a jacket when we first moved here because we didn't expect it to be as cold as it was. Thank you for helping the community when they need it!

This is a self-help based, peer-staffed oasis of recovery. They offer many services, from shelter and food etc. for those experiencing homelessness, to education and counseling for a variety of personal problems. The staff and the program participants are all friendly and helpful.

We were told we could stay there and look for a place to stay and there was no time limit. Within 2.5 weeks, we were told we could stay 30 days. When we asked how we are supposed to save up a minimum of 1500 dollars in thirty days to cover move in costs, we were told to get a rental agreement. We agreed. My wife is in the hospital, facing gallbladder surgery, and we called and told Susan, their director what was up, the only thing she gave a damn about was that stupid rental agreement, and not a tinkers damn about the fact my wife was facing a high risk operation. There really needs to be an inspector to go in and see their habits in food preparation, and how it's served. No gloves,T or hair nets. That troll that works in the kitchen, ( Terry), who is mean and always puts her nose where it does not belong needs to find another line of work. She has proven to be anything except a Christian. She sent my wife on a wild goose chase after ordering me to not park in their parking lot, and when I confronted her, she smirked. Never once was I ever so tempted to hit a woman! I truly believe this place should be either more closely monitored, or shut down.

address: 1560 Main St, Susanville, CA 96130, United States
reviews: They nothing shy of Awesome. Treat You like a Human, no matter your situation. Thank You 2 Carla, Linda, n all volunteers 🌞
God bless them.  They were wonderful and helpful.  Lots of food. That's just some of the food I got.
Awesome people with amazing services if your in need i definitely would recommend they are amazing caring people that work there
I love the ladies here 🥰

When we first found ourselves situated here in Susanville we received help from the Salvation Army in the form of hotel vouchers. The woman was very helpful and nice. She did not make us feel down or ashamed. They're located on Main Street in the Grocery Outlet shopping center. I don't see much going on here but they're open Monday through Friday from 9:00 to noon according to someone else's comment. They are a helping hand when you need one.

address: 1616 Chestnut St, Susanville, CA 96130, United States
reviews: I'm calling and going in there for a week. Nobody will answer my calls. Nobody will call me back. I did everything I was supposed to do on time and they have not done their job for over 3 weeks. No benefits. My bills are due. They now have late fees and my phone's about to get shut off. Because nobody will help me. Black hole of communication is absolutely right and nobody gives a c*** about anybody that they're supposed to be helping. I don't know why any of them even chose that as a job.
Nobody answers the phone, or emails! I’ve sent in paperwork MULTIPLE times without an answer. THEY’RE MESSING WITH FAMILIES LIVES AND IM UPSET ABOUT IT.

No call backs, a "black hole" of communication.  Already brought to the attention of the supervising staff member with no response.  Questionable competency - I have a child who's been added MedCal, dropped, and supposedly "under review".  However, with no communication, we just have to hope that nothing serious happens.  What if we're NOT approved, and insurance is needed in the meantime?
Absolutely the worst place. Never answer a call. They are rude and could care less about your time. Just call the number on the card or google it. Waste of time dealing with these people.
They weren’t able to help me so found a job on my own.

name: Lassen County Animal Shelter
address: 472-000 Johnstonville Rd, Susanville, CA 96130, United States
reviews:
I don’t understand the poor reviews for a place that literally doesn’t profit off their care and compassion.
We are fortunate to have these wonderful humans who do what they do.
I had to put my old boy down. I was recommended to call here. When I tell you that the level of compassion and care in our time of sadness and need was unmatched…believe me, these people were godsends! Literally!
They made our rough day manageable. They were so kind and caring! The way they treat their animals here is like they were family. I was in awe.
I didn’t want to see my old boy over the rainbow bridge, but I’m glad it was here, at this place full of literal angels. I can’t thank them enough.
I did call ahead. I was treated with kindness and respect
We will definitely be back to rescue a sweet soul.
Thank you to the staff! You all are wonderful people! -love Tuxfords family! ❤️

Edited to add: I was so excited when we brought our girl home, I forgot to mention a few things.. The shelter was clean and very organized even with a full house! They had dogs in almost every kennel and they were all clean and well cared for. All the dogs are vaccinated and fixed to make adoption that much easier! What a wonderful gift! We were given food, toys, a double bowl for food and water and a blanket. Everything was taken care of. There is no reason to not adopt these sweet dogs, cats, and birds.
Over the years, my husband and I have adopted 6 doggies from this shelter and every one of them has filled our lives with love and wonderful memories. Today we brought home lucky number 7(we're the lucky ones)! We love her so much already!! Thank you so much to the fantastic people who take care of these sweet babies before they find their homes. You guys are the real heroes ❤️. We brought our Sweetie (adopted in Sept 2014) to make sure everyone would get along. She's the blonde in the picture. Our new girl is the beauty with the big grin in the center 😁

Today I went to the animal shelter to take a look at a cat since I had lost the last of mine to their age issues. I found a little cat that I just immediately fell in love with and adopted her. The staff was great they sent me home with all kinds of goodies for her all the paperwork I needed etc. if you're looking for a pet give them a try first they are really nice.

Needs Bunnies there.My 11 year old daughter loves them and needs one to get into 4-H . They should put small 4- H animals up for adoption.it’s hard to find them here.she has disables and I’d love to give her a pet bunny so I went to the shelter for one.But there was none.

If your even just Thinking about it ; please  come here to adopt a dog so they don’t get euthanized. 😣 ( Adoption fees are LOW ) They are usually full and euthanize Often. Also please thumbs up to give PITS a chance and stop the immediate euthanizing of them just based off their breed 🐾🐾 .. I wish they had more staff and were open 7 days a week OR extended their hours Monday - Saturday 😣

name: Eddy House
address: 888 Willow St, Reno, NV 89502, United States
reviews: This organization is doing really great things in our community, serving homeless youth ages 18-24. I think because my four kids are in that age range currently it really tugs at my heart strings to see these kids who didn’t/don’t have the family support and are now connected to people and resources who are helping them stay warm and fed so they can also get healthy and learn new skills. Please check it out and find out ways that you can help if you are able to.

I was at a really low point in my life, needed a place to stay for a night or two. I stayed here. I was able to eat everyday that I was there. I was so thankful I had a safe environment to be. I made sure I helped with the chores. It was nice meeting new people there and making a couple friends. I'm thankful that there is a program like this for people my age because it really was a blessing. God Bless everyone who works there and the people who made/make it happen.

**Eddy's House: A Home Away From Home**

Eddy's House is more than just a shelter; it's a beacon of hope for young people in need. This incredible organization provides a safe and supportive environment for homeless youth, helping them to rebuild their lives and reach their full potential.

Here's why Eddy's House is so special:

* **Compassionate staff:** The staff at Eddy's House are dedicated and caring individuals who truly believe in the power of second chances.
* **Comprehensive services:** Eddy's House offers a variety of services to help young people, including housing, education, counseling, and job training.
* **Positive atmosphere:** The atmosphere at Eddy's House is warm and welcoming, making it feel like a true home for the youth who live there.
* **Life-changing impact:** Eddy's House has helped countless young people turn their lives around and achieve their dreams.

If you're looking for a way to make a difference in the lives of young people, consider supporting Eddy's House. Your donation can help provide a safe and supportive home for homeless youth.

Giving chocolate to the neighborhood for Christmas isn't going to help us with the increase in vehicle vandalism in the area. My vehicle has been broken into multiple times since you fellas have been here. Never had a problem before but now we got kids smoking weed and drinking Hennessey on the street during day-time. If you have millions to spend for expansion, how about I get reimbursed for the damages your tenets have caused. Now that would be a true Christmas Gift

One of the best homeless shelter you can stay at. The youths advocate are amazing, supposed, kind and care. The case manager are very helpful. All around the best homeless shelter out there. Thank you so much for the help, support and kindness that everyone show at the Eddy house.

Very good place, a blessing for those in need, bed, showers, good food 3 times a day, and more, if needed, thank God for places like this

reviews: This horrible organization helped a man file a restraining order against a woman that is the true victim of this man that is making false accusations against this female. Now the female can’t seek help from this organization due to conflict of interest. I guess this organization should be called Menhaven from now on!

Going back to 2016 & 2017 I don't even know where to start . But I will say I could never forget your names martha cabay , Sonia, Gina etc etc the list of woman that torn me apart during my process during my healing from domestic violence was awful . I have came so far now and I have open my eyes in a lot of things that was against the rules that they did to me I have so much more to say ! One day I will write about it .

I've had a frustrating experience at a thrift store, where an older gray-haired lady working at the register repeatedly has questioned me about the price of the merchandise I was trying to buy. She ended up trying to charge me more than what was shown on the sticker, claiming that the price was incorrect. As customers, we deserve to be treated with respect, and if the tag price is incorrect, the staff should report it to their supervisor instead of charging us more. Although the rest of the staff is great, I wouldn't recommend this thrift store whenever this particular lady is at the register.

Very rude staffs i met 3 rude staffs so far. Tanisha with the christmas program and shelter needs to ve replcae not reporting a very concerning case and giving ppl she knows priority and they have favortisms when it comes to gifts adoption program and even more concerning not reporting things that need to ve report i can easily proove that and letting clients from shlter come the next day or come after cerfuew hrs. This place is bot what they say rhey are.

Every time I go to this thrift store the old lady working at the register in the front charges me more then what their sign says, or if there’s a sticker with the price on the item she always charges me more. This has happened like 4 times already. The rest of the staff is GREAT but none of them work on the register. I would NOT recommend this thrift store at all.

name: Lighthouse Rescue Mission
address: 111 W Kern Ave, Tulare, CA 93274, United States
reviews: It is an amazing place if you desire change. Even if you just need to pick yourself up n start over.. Staff is so supportive. I've tryed other things but from the directors to the sisters here. It's not by accident that we are where we are.. We truly are blessed

My entire life has been a struggle. Until I found the lighthouse. After 23 years in prison I didn't know what the future held for me. With the help and dedication of the lighthouse family I am now employed and building my life. I feel like a red carpet is being rolled out in front of me and all I have to do is walk it. There is something truly special about this place. They will help you if you are ready to help yourself. Special thanks to Junior and Karen. Awesome people. God bless them and all of you.

Faith based program with a few different sites that help men women and children. This place is a blessing to the homeless community and its definitely a privilege to know the men and women dedicated to God that work here. They are doing God's work.
They offer overnight shelter,  men's workforce,women's workforce, room and Board, academy program,thrift store and recycling center all within a 4 block radius.

These people are very rude. They allow alot of harassment to go on there. They show favoritism there which is why my daughter and I almost got kicked out. One of the staff members that worked there was very unprofessional as a worker. She was the one that said we would have to leave if I didn't stop responding to being harassed.

They're really nice people that really they're a blessing to help everybody and anyone they can I thank the Lord for them cuz they gave me a place to stay so if you're ever going on your luck go to them and they will help you out with the place to stay showers Junior that runs it God has really blessed you I have no negative things to say about this place
The gentleman auggie that runs it is a really nice good Christian man he cares for the people I would help him out anyway I can he's helped me and I would help him so whoever opened it for the people that need us to have a place to stay in and a good meal I'll give you a good man I think the Lord for him

name: Central California Family Crisis
address: 211 N Main St, Porterville, CA 93257, United States
reviews: I would like to thank all the staff at the shelter. I grew & was able to get back on my feet into my own 3 bd room home although I wasn't able to stay living in Porterville I was still able to move into a home in Fresno county. Thank you all for your support & direction to being a mother who can change things for my children.... Sincerely Rosalinda (Linda) G

Excellent customer service, always kind and detail-oriented, the front desk seems to know exactly what I need every time. I cannot find any reason to complain about this agency, except that there aren't enough organizations that provide the same services to assist individuals with the same type of need.

This place is a joke. Took a class for a year. Was pretty much just show up. Jump around go home, aside from that my kid's mother came here when we were going to child custody and they wrote a long fault statement for her about me stating I was a drug user abuser and all was on my record and let's just say when we showed up to court aside from the judge telling my kids' mother how ridiculous her false statements were since I had no such record ultimately my kids' mother was not given anything she asked for and I would granted pretty much everything so anyone seeking help I would recommend finding a more suitable agency because all you'll find here is stupidity if we're being honest
I have to say that I learned so much during my time here. I also want to say thank you to Virginia for hearing me out. I send you a warm embrace.
The ladies at the front desk have the worst attitude and they should be the ones taking anger management classes SO RUDE !!

name: Visalia Rescue Mission
address: 741 N Santa Fe St, Visalia, CA 93292, United States
reviews: They need to educate homeless people that they have to respect the residential areas near the shelter. It’s rally a big problem. They poop I front the property and throw all their trash,even the food that you give them. They stay overnight in front of residences.that’s not enough.they do drugs and sex
Called for donation pick up and never came, rescheduled and again didn’t come. Respect peoples time

I come here often because I love finding unique items or old school things. Some of the clothing is a little over priced to be honest, and make sure to check for stains. If you point out that the item is stained or ripped they don't change the price, so check your items before you buy #mamaonabudget

SHAME on this place, encouraging homelessness is all they do.  They are a magnet to the area for garbage, noise, drugs, and nuisances.  I live in the area and have to deal with them walking down the street and living in vacant lots.

This place should take a real look at themselves in the mirror.  Is it really Christian to encourage people and support such a lifestyle? I think it is only Christian to rehabilitate people.

Response to Owner: This is a community issue that you created.

The prices here are a bit pricy for a thrift store. They are about the same prices at Wall-Mart. The only difference is at Wall-Mart the items are new. Last year the store had better prices specially for low income customers. I doubt Jesus wouldn’t appreciate the price jacking specially for the needy and helpless.

name: Bakersfield Homeless Center
address: 1600 E Truxtun Ave, Bakersfield, CA 93305, United States
reviews: Horrible and disgusting place, the food is expired, my daughter got sick drinking spoiled milk that looked like it came from a elementary school who didn't want to waste milk. The staff here treat you like your IQ is less than of an infant and inforce rules that are unethical. The residents here are unbelievably senseless and irresponsible and small minded ppl.and the worse part is being locked out of the dorms all day including the heat.most ppl who can't be in the heat due to medical conditios stay lock from 1pm- 3pn  Everything there is unorganized and no one follows the rules kids unsupervised all the time and. In. My defense I have a past here and I know more than anyone that place needs to be thoroughly looked at this place isn't what they make it out to seem a happy and go lucky place when it's a disaster behind closed doors. Kids peeing on the floor and no one does anything about it. No parents and no staff to be seen.
It's always beautiful wen someone loves you like God does.thank you.

Just drop off your donations and someone will help you. Seems like there aren’t very many people working there and there is very few spaces to park but I hope the donations help someone there, and truthfully, that’s all that matters!

this place needs to be investigated. they serve you rotten, moldy expired food. they favor certain types of people, as in they'll help certain people and drag their feet on other people. most of those services they advertise online they don't even do in real life. if someone made a call to the right person this place would get shut down

They do good work. Providing housing to indigent women, children and men. They help with re-housing, serviceable clothing and what can be called food if you are hungry enough. There are plenty of problems with the place and the way its run, but it makes the best it can given what and who it has to work with. Please donate gently used items of any kind, I really mean anything a human can use, it helps more than you would believe.

name: Love-A-Child Missions Homeless Recovery Shelter
address: 2279 Willow Pass Rd, Bay Point, CA 94565, United States
reviews: If you are motivated self-sufficient, trying to find permanent housing, and just in need of a safe place to get on your feet. This is not the place for you. They bring you under the guise that it is a homeless shelter, they first tell you your paying for shelter fees and that they want a 3 month commitment $650 a month for single bed in a shared room then once you sign you are told you are paying for “ the program” no one is paying the same amount almost like they charge what they want to charge that moment but in reality “the program “ is being enforced by other homeless residents who can be found in their spare time panhandling at the local grocery store. They are taken advantage of women in need and most of the positive reviews are the favored residents and friends of the director I have filed reports with dhcs/dfeh THEY ARE TAKING ADVANTAGE OF THE HOMELESS WHOM THEY KNOW HAVE VERY LITTLE OPTIONS IF YOU HAVE OTHER OPTIONS TAKE THEM THIS “program” is a set up

The place is infested with mice and roaches!!! The directors refuse to call pest control all they do is bomb and put down boric acid which obviously is NOT working. boric acid is extremely poisonous and there are a lot of young children living there which is concerning. It’s $400 for you and $100 per child. Some residents were paying over $800 to live in filth with bugs and rodents. It’s extremely sad. Me and my child were sick our entire time at love a child, we didn’t get better until we left. I had to take my child to the emergency room because a roach was stuck in their ear and my child was admitted and had to be treated for an infection with antibiotic's. The director dismissed me from the program because I had to stay overnight in the hospital with my child but honestly I was relieved because I did not want to return! They threatened to throw all of my belongings away if I did not retrieve by the end of the day. They wrote me up for missing church although I provided them a doctor’s note stating that me and my child were sick. I constantly got written up because the rules are unclear and certain rules only apply to certain residents. The staff are residents but they get away with things that other residents get written up for. They’re allowed to let their children play outside unattended with no shoes or proper clothes on but if another resident does that they are written up. The staff residents will literally write you up for anything just because they can. This program is obviously taking advantage of vulnerable women with children. Staff residents are obvious drug users but directors do not care. They do not drug test you upon acceptance into the program so they basically let anyone in. They say that they do random drug tests but the residents I talked to on a daily basis while I was there said they had never been drug tested during their time there. One resident even bragged about leaving to go smoke Meth. They do not provide any housing resources! They do not do case management! All they do is take your money and give you a bunk bed in a filthy cottage ingested with roaches and mice. BEWARE

I was fleeing domestic violence, my abuser is actively searching for me. I was dismissed from the program for being in the main office at 7pm.

I was a late intake the day previously and had support with my domestic violence advocate. I was extremely tired and didn’t catch all of the information. I figured I would find out more the next day. I went to sleep, left the property early on the morning- before 645a to get to work. The website says that they help with transportation to work, THEY DONT. It took me 3 hours to get to work via bus and BART for a 3 hour shift, and another 2-3 hours to get back. I was gone all day.

I called the program prior to arriving, letting them know I was gone at work and making my way back. I arrived back to the property around 645p and entered the office.  I went in to ask questions about the program, how to fill out my schedule, and what I needed to do for classes, etc. I left quite early in the morning and knew I missed information so I was just asking for tips.

I am not familiar with Pittsburg at all and wanted to know more about the are, how to get around, advice and things like that. As I was talking to the woman, we talked about God, my journey, etc. I felt so much better. All of a sudden a woman named Courtney whom I have never met before or seen before came in to say that I wasn’t allowed to be in there. She spoke to the woman as if I were not there and said something along the lines of “you can’t let these people in here just tell them no. I saw the camera.” It was extremely rude and unwelcoming and I calmly explained that I was a new intake, and wanted to know more information and I took it upon myself to come in and ask what the requirements were, what I missed, classes.

The woman, Courtney said I needed to leave and could finish tomorrow. She then started speaking down to the new employee. This new employee is part of their work adjustment program and only made $10 for the WHOLE 8 hour shift. I calmly explained again to Courtney that this woman was just trying to help. I’m fleeing domestic violence and I’m in an unfamiliar area. Courtney said someone would call me and explain. I don’t believe that because nobody called me that day, I actually called in twice, and nobody knew who I was.

I explained to Courtney that I didn’t appreciate her tone and asked how they would get ahold of me since they failed to do so… and she quickly glanced at my work schedule and was like “we can have an appointment with you on Tuesday at 130p. I said that’s fine but I want my DV advocate there. As I’m trying to pack up to leave, she says, that Love a Child has no gates and I’m free to leave whenever I want. I explained that that was not what I wanted and I was grateful to be there.

I told her I wasn’t feeling comfortable talking to her, explained I had a social work background, and legal background. She asked what does it have to do with the conversation. I explained that she was escalating the situation, I have PTSD. She got visibly upset, and said I was being insubordinate and I was dismissed from the program. I asked her to please call my advocate and that any discussions and decisions need to be made by her as my PTSD symptoms were exacerbated by her.

She proceeded to cal police and told them I was there refusing to leave property. I said alright thank you, please call my advocate. They could not get in touch with my advocate.

As I was walking back to my unit (where I had only been there one night), she approached me saying I was free to pack my stuff. I was already going to grab my stuff, what was the point of her approaching me like that? To exacerbate my symptoms even MORE?

Apparently Courtney goes to Bay Church Concord, I also attend there. I’m so disappointed in how she handled the situation. This is not how a Christian behaves. I slept on the street last night. Had nothing with me and it was 50 degrees last night.
Isaiah 54:17 is what gets me through. But I am so sad and hurt by the lack of support especially female support.

Tbh I had the worst experience i was in the hospital take to mind I was pregnant they called me the next day after I delivered my baby that if I didn’t pay my program fees I would lose my bed I had no where else to go I had my 2 kids my oldest 8 my middle 6 and my newborn they had no sympathy for what I was going through. This program lacks compaction and respect for there residents and the office needs lots of work Shannon needs to get out the office and Courtney needs to open her eyes. I am thankful but living at love a child shouldn’t b hard like they make it.

I didn’t get the chance to stay here. But I did go through the application process . This shelter charges $450 for a single person to stay in a bed with also a $50 intake fee. This is a lot for someone who has zero income. They said that they would help even if you could not pay . But for me there’s too many requirements that made my decision about staying here. One requirement that surprised me is that If your dr has prescribed meds to you, you have to be on them to come into this program. Which was a no for me because I was in the process of changing drs & the medication she had me on induced diabetes so I had to stop taking them. If you want to be in this program you have to take all meds prescribed by your doctor no excuses. I would not recommend based off how much you have to pay just to be provided a bed.
